Salt Dwellers

The salt dwellers are an indigenous group who live in the many caves along the east and southern coasts of Ensulasia. They are most active during the night and are therefore not seen often. In appearance, they are very similar to humans although they have larger eyes and webbed digits. They are also able to stay underwater for significantly longer than a human, up to 10 minutes on a single dive. It is thought therefore that they are a hybrid between humans and mer-people many generations back.
